perturbation.original_text: 2.1 All capitalized terms shall have the meaning as defined in the Clauses of this Contract and/or in Clause 2 of the Manual of the Shipper of ECOPETROL.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 All capitalized terms shall have the meaning as defined in the Clauses of this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the reference to Clause 2 of the Manual of the Shipper, any capitalized terms only defined in the Manual of Shipper now lack a definition in the contract. This creates ambiguity and contradiction, particularly if those terms are used in other clauses without clarification, rendering those clauses unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 The minimum values of quality that the Crude delivered by the Senders must have to be accepted for Transportation in the Pipeline are: For specific systems the Transporter defines minimum parameters for quality which are listed in Annex 4 Minimum Quality Specifications by System.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 The minimum values of quality that the Crude delivered by the Senders must have to be accepted for Transportation in the Pipeline are:
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Annex 4, the section on quality requirements becomes vague. The contract refers to 'minimum values of quality', but removes the specifics, creating a contradiction with the expectation that such values are defined somewhere.

perturbation.original_text: 23.2 Without prejudice of the foregoing, only in the following cases information may be disclosed: 23.3 For any information to be disclosed, that must be or wished to be disclosed as established in previous numerals, only the disclosure in question shall proceed after consulting, if the period granted by law or the authority ordaining the disclosure of the information allows it, with the Party that has provided the information. a) When the disclosure of information is mandatory by law; b) When the disclosure of information is ordered by a competent authority; c) When the information in question is of public domain, without any action or omission from the Parties; or d) When the entity providing the information authorizes it, in each case, previously and in writing;
perturbation.changed_text: 23.2 Information may be disclosed only when the entity providing the information authorizes it, in each case, previously and in writing;
perturbation.explanation: By removing some of the cases where information may be disclosed it introduces contradictions by removing exceptions, and making the contract unenforceable. It also generates uncertainty in enforcement.
